studyAmendmentImpacts.affectedSection: Section 7 - Statistical Methods & Determination of Sample Size
studyAmendmentImpacts.description: Sample size increased to approximately 240 subjects to accommodate more countries and higher dropout rates.

studyAmendmentImpacts.affectedSection: Section 4.3 - Loading Dose, Continuous Infusion Rates, Titration, and Extra Doses
studyAmendmentImpacts.description: Clarified F3 infusion rate reduction limits and medical necessity requirements.
Modified/added criteria to exclude subjects positive for COVID-19.

studyAmendmentImpacts.affectedSection: Section 5.8 - Study Drug and Study Devices
studyAmendmentImpacts.description: Added guidance on cannula length selection and infusion site rotation.
Changed reporting timeframe for product complaints to 24 hours.

studyAmendmentReasons.reasonText: Necessary protocol modifications due to the COVID-19 pandemic to minimize risk to subjects.
To provide further guidance to Investigators in the event of an infusion site reaction.
To mitigate the risk of muscle wall infiltration leading to pain and/or occlusion of the cannula.
To provide general guidance to investigators on possible causes of hallucinations/psychosis.
Correct minor clerical errors for consistency throughout the protocol.

studyChanges.summary: Updated sample size estimation to account for additional countries and higher-than-expected dropout rate.

studyChanges.afterText: F3 infusion rate may be reduced beyond the 20% limit... with approval from the AbbVie TA MD
studyChanges.summary: Clarified that F3 infusion rate reduction beyond 20% is permissible if medically necessary.
Added COVID-19 positivity as an exclusion criterion.
Changed the reporting timeframe for product complaints to 24 hours.
Removed references to caregivers throughout protocol and Operations Manual.
